Reviews.Author: Tiffany
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this place! First time I went with my sister and we are Star Wars/ Comic fans and we loved it so much! The same week I was back in Vegas and took my boyfriend his brother and his girlfriend and they also loved it! It's a fun chill spot to hangout at, BB-8 drink was soooo good like candy to me, Deadpool drink was also pretty good! We will all definitely be back! The owner is very nice also, only thing we didn't not like was that the bartender kept closing our tabs after we ordered every single time... We didn't want to close are tabs till the end of the night... That was just weird.

Reviews.Author: Amy
Reviews.Content: We were greeted at the door by the owner, Alex, who showed us the menus and the bar. Super nice guy. Got us off to a great start, we felt comfortable right away.  The bartenders were all very welcoming and helpful. They only have a handful specialty drinks, but a fully stocked bar as well. Nice atmosphere, really comfortable seats and couches. We went earlier in the night, so there was plenty of space.  A really fun idea for a bar! We hope to go back for a trivia night or party.

Reviews.Author: Armando
Reviews.Content: Honestly one of the coolest bars. Genius wish there was a hangout spot that that around my house in Chicago. Great prices for drinks, environment that is provided is very very comfortable distractions everywhere from Star Wars, to Harry Potter, dragon balls in the bar. Everything!!! Giving the bar it's unique concept that has a lot of items that will catch your eye and help you carry conversations if needed. Alex was amazing also and always gave us the best service I could as for. Will stop by every time I'm in vegas to see what's new and what has been added to this awesome place.

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth
Reviews.Content: Soooo...  I was super skeptical of this place when we got invited to our friends birthday party here. I wanted to love former Lady Silvia...but it just never happen. It was stuffy, quiet, and kinda snobby.  MF......totally different. Everyone is welcome and everyone fits in. I thought I would NEVER EVER say this about a  bar  in Vegas but I am.  Growing up, my father is a total Star Trek fan. I guess I inherited it. I own all the original series books first run and most of the other series books. I have read them all many times. Fast forward a few light years and the flame is still burning.  We were welcomed by the super nice bartender which come to find out I know him/met him from way back in 2009. Wow. I caught up with him and we laughed about the crazy days back at where he used to bartend.  Anyway everyone in our party was taken care of with high standards and Alex the owner is super nice. He complimented me about my looks and how I remind him of the Bronte sisters books...then I explained to him they are my favorite authors...odd, maybe, but then again maybe Destiny...  Maybe this place just holds a special place in my heart, but it seemed like everyone around us...felt just at as home as we did.  Thank you MF for making a great place where everyone can call  home .

Reviews.Author: Casey
Reviews.Content: I'm not a bar person, but I will be frequenting this place. My boyfriend and I went last night because we saw they were having a Star Wars evening and figured everyone there would have seen the film...we were wrong about that, but it was okay! Our planned hour long stay turned into 4 hours after the owner (who may be the most delightful person I have ever met) set us up with the 3 other folks in the bar who had seen the film.   The atmosphere is more like going to someone's house than a traditional bar. There are neat little knick knacks, several TVs that play nerdy movies, and they aren't finished setting everything up. They plan to have some rad nerdy art which I am really looking forward to.   I can't wait to see them mature and evolve. I hope this place is around for a long, long time.

Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: Wonderful night tonight. Usually my friday nights are spent dancing over at Boomers but tonight I was invited by a good friend to join him at Millenium Fandom. I was pleasantly surprised at how friendly and warm the reception was. Finding new friends that talked about subjects ranging from Starcraft, cosplay ideas, card games and then the dreaded  Which is better Star Trek or Star Wars?  I will be making Millenium Fandom a part of my friday night shenanigans from this point on and wednesdays for trivia night. Great place to be.

Reviews.Author: Morgan
Reviews.Content: Great people, great vibe, great drinks, great theme. Their long island iced tea is too good! The owner is so friendly, welcoming, and nerdy. You can tell he's put a lot of love into this place. They host several events a week so it's easy to meet fun people here. The couches are fun and the overall ambiance is a relaxing blend of dark wood library and Paris salon apartment. The owner is very passionate about supporting local artists and many of his fandom decorations are commissioned. Love going here! A perfect place to be your 'Cheers.'

Reviews.Author: Meg
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic place! We booked our trip to Vegas and panicked when we realized it was during the Game of Thrones finale. We quickly searched online for a place that airs the show. The Millennium Fandom bar saved the day! We took a $9 uber from the strip. They have around 6 large screen TVs where they aired the GOT finale at both 6pm and 9pm. We were worried we would not be able to hear the show and to our delight the sound was played loudly through the entire bar. All of the patrons knew to stay quiet when it was on. The bar had fun couches and chairs for seating. Drinks were cheap! 4 coronas for $12. Alright! You can order food from the sandwich shop next door and they deliver it. The food was absolutely delicious! The owner of this place has a lot of heart and we could tell he cared about his guests and establishment. Thank you for a wonderful experience! We will be back next time we're in Vegas!

Reviews.Author: Brooklyn
Reviews.Content: First time going last night, It is really amazing! The way they decorated the place is so cool! It definitely is a cool place to go if you like to dress up(cosplay) and not feel judged! Oh, and they have an awesome light up R2D2 in the middle of the room! PLUS the owner makes it a priority to stop by and introduce himself! And the bartenders are really nice as well!

Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: The force is strong with this place...  The moment I walked through the doors, a flood of nerdvana washed over me and embraced me! Actually, that was the owner that was greeting us! Apparently, I guess this place is filled with mostly locals and the owner does a great job of spotting new folks and welcoming us to the unique experience.   I'm going to start off with the awesome decors. His walls are filled with Predator masks, the triforce shield, frostmourne, light sabers, and a R2D2 right in the middle. To be honest, you can have a blast just looking at the walls. The bar itself is pretty small, I would say this place can fit up to a 100 people so it's more like a speak easy size. However, there was hip hop music blaring which made it pretty difficult to talk to. Honestly, the music kind of killed the mood for me because if we wanted loud music we could have been to any of the other hundreds of clubs in Vegas. Instead, I would have preferred video game OSTs or maybe live karaoke. Furthermore, there are a lot of chairs and tables to sit at. Unfortunately, I feel like this works against the bar experience because everyone just sits down with their clique. The environment isn't conducive for people trying to strike up conversations and to mingle.  As for the drinks, this place is a deal. Almost all of the cocktails were $10. I got the BB8 which tasted like an alcoholic horchata. My friend got a double pour of glenffidich for like $10. Beers are $5. Overall, the alcohol here tastes great and is super reasonably priced compared to the $20 drinks you get in Vegas.   Overall, asides from a few critiques, this place is a nerd gem. It's not every day you can drink your scotch next to a R2D2, with a spiderman cosplayer and watching kill la kill. This place gets 2 light sabers up!

Reviews.Author: Aaron
Reviews.Content: I'm a regular at this bar and I absolutely love it and I mean LOVE it.  I found out about it via twitter and originally wanted to go for my 21st but couldn't make it. I then found out about their pre party for Wizard World Comic Con and decided to go dressed as Malcolm Reynolds. This bar is a fantastic place for geeky people to come and socialize and to also get away from the  club  crowd of the strip and Fremont. The bar is filled with nothing but wonderful people who are easy to talk to and also geeky artifacts from Raiders of the Lost Ark to Hellraiser.  There are board games and card games to play and cosplay is 100% encouraged!!!!!        I'm a cosplayer who finds it hard outside of Comic Cons to meet like minded people who don't find it weird that I dress like Malcolm Reynolds or Captain Kirk on occasion so it's nice to find a joint that celebrates geek culture and encourages it.  The drink prices are very reasonable especially for a college student like myself and it keeps me coming back. The owner is amazingly cool and nice and always comes to greet me when I come in. The bartenders are nice and it's always cool to see Black Canary lol.  The people who frequent this bar like I said earlier are always nice people and never jerks or typical hell raising party types. In fact just last weekend a few people invited me to a game of Cards Against Humanity and we all ended up playing a good 2 hours.  I don't think that there is a better bar/lounge/hangout in Vegas for geeks or people in general. If you're a gamer, cosplayer, star wars fan, browncoat (like me!!), or a geek in general then this bar is 100% for you.  They also occasionally on special nights like the pre party for Wizard World have a DJ that plays music. During these days the place turns from a lounge to a small club but a really nice and cool club!!!!   There is plenty of parking so don't worry  plenty of beer choices and they even carry my favorite Newcastle Brown Ale which a lot of places don't.   Really great, cool and creative specialty drinks  Really cool bartenders who are all really really awesome and nice people!

Reviews.Author: Denise
Reviews.Content: I finally got down here to check this place out!    I loved The Lady Silvia, so I was glad to see the familiar decor/furniture, though most of the books were gone from the shelf to make way for various geeky fandom artifacts. Upon walking in, my date and I were immediately greeted in a genuine, cheerful manner by both the bartender and the owner (who got up to shake our hands). \  The music was a nice mix of the deep house-ish genre (not distracting in volume or lyric clutter), the lighting was dim (conducive to chilling out), the temp was just right. The owner conversed with us for awhile, filling us in on all of the awesome plans he has for this wonderful bar!    The reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 was this: we had 2 basic drinks, and the bill was $16. That's a bit steep in my opinion. Were they made well? Sure, but $8 is $8. The owner did mention if individuals wear their cosplay costumes (any day/time), they get 20% off, which would make the prices better to consume multiple libations! The other reason for the 4 stars is how empty the shelves were. Now I will say this, after talking at length with the owner, he expressed that he wants to leave the filling up of many of those shelves to local driven geek/fandom art. And I can 100% appreciate that, I really can. I just would like to see maybe more temporary artifacts up so that walking in and taking in the entirety of the bars aesthetic doesn't leave one feeling that they stumbled in before it was ready/open as opposed to being a work in progress (if that makes sense).   There are already fun nights in the works (Harry Potter meetups, Star wars, board game nights, cosplay nights, etc), and coming up on February 19th is a Steampunk ball!   I'll be excited to see this place grow and once I've gone a few more times, I'm sure my 4 stars will turn to 5!

Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: Loved it! Owner is involved and passionate about all things sci-fi and   nerd .  He tried to explain to my wife the concept of a  mash-up  of Predator in a Han Solo Carbonite freeze as a display for his display wall. She was more concerned with any cosplay with Predator involved... She didn't want anyone to walk in the place looking like Predator.  We then met some fans of  Attack on Titan  - which we were completely unfamiliar with... but were  explained on a basic level the main character (since there was some cosplay involved there on that night)  The place is clean, the drinks are super reasonable, and the people are friendly and predictably in their element. Which is a good thing.  We will return!

Reviews.Author: Megan
Reviews.Content: I'm a regular at Millennium. I was introduced to this place by a friend who lives in the building and it's now my favorite bar in Vegas. Why? Because I can have honest, intelligent conversations with real people here. These awesome nerds are my soulmates and I make new friends every time I go. Where else are you encouraged to come in cosplay? Alex Pusineri is everything a proprietor should be, he learns your name and introduces you to other people, he spends time with customers, he encourages diverse and intelligent conversation...creating a nerd-dom bar like the Cheers of olde.   Here are some of my many amazing Millennium experiences: Dancing with the Ghostbusters, playing Cards Against Humanity, discussing zombie apocalypse plans, debating Marvel vs. DC, trying to figure out which Con is the best. So many memories already, and I look forward to many more!  Parking: Plenty available. Some street, some paid lot. Bar: Well stocked, good prices. Bartenders: I've met Peter, Monica, Linda, and Sean so far and they're all awesome! Space/decor: Nerd lair, perfect for plotting to take over the world (like we do every night).   So get off your butts and get thee to the Millennium Fandom Bar. Zod demands it. Kneel before Zod.

Reviews.Author: Luis
Reviews.Content: Best bar for geeks, need, and cosplayer. COME HERE. Friendly and all fandom is all welcome it's safe heaven . Every time I visit here I will come to this bar and spend a few drinking and talking with people with same fandom it's heaven for all nerds

Reviews.Author: Kayla
Reviews.Content: From the moment you walk in your feel welcomed by everyone in the place. The owner, Alex is there as your host and is a fabulous one at that! If I lived in Vegas I would be there every night they're open just for the atmosphere, people and great service. It seems like there is always something fun going on like themed nights, viewings and events and the best part is you can dress up or not and still will have an amazing time. You don't have to be an expert at fandom knowledge to appreciate this gem. The walls are filled with beautiful local art and books to give a library feel. It feels like a geeky speak easy in the most amazing way.   I happened to go for my first time with a couple of friends. They ended up leaving early and I decided to stay. Now as a young female I would like to point out that I would never feel comfortable staying at most Vegas bars by myself. However Alex introduced me to some of the locals and it was so much fun! We all watched YouTube videos and carried the conversation till closing. Alex even made sure I got to my car safely!   In just the few hours I spent there I felt I knew the people I met for years. The cute bartenders were amazing as well, giving me suggestions on new drinks to try. Linda was telling me about all the cosplay outfits she owns, she can really pull them off too!   I would suggest taking a look at their social media pages as they always have something fun going on. I can't wait till I'm in Vegas again to visit!

Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: To start if I could give this place 6 stars I would. I don't do reviews often but I will if the place truly deserves it. Me and my wife came to vegas for the weekend and after doing the usual night club scene the first few nights we knew we needed something different.  Its located a mile or two north of the encore. It has good creative drinks, relaxed atmosphere, and nostalgic movie and video game novelties including a full size and functioning R2-D2. The owner is incredibly inviting and will even let you take pictures with some of his collection. The crowd is some of the most welcoming and warm people to hang out with even if they are dressed up a little scary (it was super villian night that night). I hope this bar does well because when I come back here with my friends I'm bringing everybody here for a special trip.

Reviews.Author: Jeremy
Reviews.Content: Seriously best place we visited while we were in town. Made it a point to check it out,unfortunately we only had time around 6pm so the place was dead. But the owner was beyond friendly,actually the coolest person I met in town.  Epic bar and epic attitude.  We most definitely come back for this incredible place.

Reviews.Author: Shannon
Reviews.Content: I had such a great time at Millenium tonight!  I met some interesting people and had some great conversations while sitting at the bar.  I remember the Old Lady Silvia at this location which is pretty much the same minus the books add some paint and a Captain America shield and R2D2 centerpiece.   I guess they are going for a nerdy type hangout which is fine. Everyone is really nice and approachable and friendly.  I enjoyed the Ballast point on tap but many alcohol choices were available at the well stocked bar.     What I'm most excited about is that the new Goodwich location is opening up two doors down from the Millennium Fandom Bar.  Oh how amazing will that be?  Patio seating and all.   So looking forward to the Grand Opening.  I will be back.

Reviews.Author: Kim
Reviews.Content: I used to live at Soho and the owners of Lady Silvia were never as involved as Alex is with Millennium.  He makes a point of being there and welcoming everyone.  I am not into the themes but I still feel welcome and he manages to cater to the locals & theme driven individuals equally.  Where else can you hang out with locals, play with Star Wars decor & possibly see bat girl?

Reviews.Author: Cammy
Reviews.Content: Cute decor and super friendly crowds here at Millennium Fandom! A dream bar for nerds and star wars fans all around! The drinks even have clever names, and are about $10 each. You can get a 20% discount for your first check in. My favorite drink is called The Dark Side. The other cocktails are a bit too sweet for my taste.

Reviews.Author: Channele
Reviews.Content: I'm a nerd. You're probably a nerd. We all have something we are passionate about, and this bar highlights that.  Tucked away in a high-rise condo downtown, this bar is simply beautiful in every way. It is very modern, very minimal but absolutely gives nods to some of the biggest pop culture fandoms of today: Star Wars, Avengers, Harry Potter, Fast & The Furious, Miyazaki and more.  Not really a nerd? Then most of what you'll notice is the simplicity of the black walls with shelves, lavish couches and chairs, and moderate-volume music so conversations are easily had.  The owner, Alex, has definitely put a lot of time, love and thought into this gorgeous bar. He's also very friendly and receptive - say hi! The bartenders on each of my visits have been fantastic as well.  If you're looking for gaming or smoking, go elsewhere. There's plenty of that around town. If you want to relax in a chic geek environment where you can converse, stop on by. Have a drink. Share your fandom.

Reviews.Author: Melissa
Reviews.Content: Finally got the chance to check this place out with my friend who rants and rave about this bar. We went last night to a Nightmare Before Christmas Party. This place is a little hidden treasure, we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Author: Randolph
Reviews.Content: Awesome experience! I visited for the Game of Thrones viewing party. Loved the atmosphere of the bar, there's lots of encouragement for patrons to share their Fandom interests. Really laid back atmosphere, good conversation and good laughs.

Reviews.Author: Isabella
Reviews.Content: I love this place! The drinks are reasonably priced, it's very inviting and welcoming to all types of people. You are almost guaranteed to see someone in costume (and they have a yelp check in discount on drinks). Also the owner of the bar, Alex, is very involved with his clientele and is super friendly! There is always some fun event going on no matter what day of the week it is!

Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: We went to the comic con after hours party, great cosutmes, and a fun time.  We will definitely go again next year and check the website for any cool events like this.  I'm not sure what it's like during  normal  days but their website is full of events and drinks are not expensive.  Parking right across the street is $5 but that's not their fault.

Reviews.Author: Raul
Reviews.Content: This place is very much a big, nerdy clubhouse. The decor was great, and the staff was friendly. If I'd have to compare it to another local spot, the Golden Tiki comes to mind a little, but Tiki does have a better menu. Speaking of the drinks: they were solid, and come in at $10 a pop for a rocks glass of mixed drink, and ice. My wife and I each had a Rumchata-based drink. She had a  The Dude',  which was like spicy horchata. I had a BB-8, which was creamy, butterscotch horchata goodness. Oh, it should be noted that you do get 20% off your check if you show up in full cosplay regalia though. Which I found a clever way of getting people in costume. My wife and I didn't see anyone dressed up at the time, but we did meet a guy that was at the first San Diego Comic Con, and walked into the pre-gaming for cosplay workshop.   This brings me to what I thought was one of the strong points of this spot: the crowd. The crowd, as a whole, was very welcoming. Though there was the odd, silent hipster couple, most of the crowd was happily nerding out, with a passionate debate happening at the bar over a round of Cards Against Humanity, and other groups discussing cosplay construction and conventions.  It is very much in a transitive state though. There are still lots of hints that it was built on the bones of the Lady Silvia. This means not everything is set up yet, but what is displayed screams nerdy fandom, and geeky potential. Lots of  kingdoms  are represented: DC Comics, Marvel, Game of Thrones, Anime (Cowboy Bebop! Dragon Ball!), Alien, Indiana Jones, Bioshock, Star Wars all over the place, and even some Fast and the Furious thrown in there. They also seem to have a lot of events already lined up: The Cure afterparty, Wednesday Trivia nights, Game of Throne nights, etc.  To close: I'd go again.

Reviews.Author: Felicia
Reviews.Content: Came here for the CAC event and was very disappointed. A lot of the Lady Silva's furniture and decorations are still here. The  nerdom  decorations look completely unfinished and they've been open for a month?  The red headed bartender with the cat ears was nice but seemed like she had never bartended before and was moving at a snail's pace. The manager saw that it was starting to get busy and instead of helping he was reading behind the bar and gingerly walking around.  I stood at the bar for 10-15 minutes before being greeted and the bar wasn't even full. My gin soda was flat. There were some horror decorations and a guitar. It doesn't even make sense.  I would give this place zero stars if I could.

Reviews.Author: Melanie
Reviews.Content: This has got to be one of my favorite bars ever. From the friendly staff to the figurines to the undying fandom fans that come.... welcome to your home away from home. As a cosplayer, anime binger, comiccon attendee this feels like the good ole days where you can start a conversation with strangers about Blade to Akira to James Bond. Can't wait for their themed nights!!

Reviews.Author: Martain
Reviews.Content: This is a neat place to hang out for a little while for certain kinds of people.  It's really great for a gamer like me to all the cool collectibles and look though the game library.  But unless you like bars or have friends to hang out with the interest wears off after an hour.  It's really great that people show up in costume.  There is a small game library but with the music turned up your not going to enjoy a game.  For the 60 people that like this place they will really like it and hopefully that is enough to keep them in business.

Reviews.Author: Sammi
Reviews.Content: This place has a lot of nerdy guys ! Got invited with some friends ! We all had a great time ! It was fun drinking with my friends and hanging out just for fun !!!

Reviews.Author: Andrea
Reviews.Content: Such a cool place! I remember coming here a few years ago when it was a speak easy and they good a job of transforming it into this new bar.   Great place to channel your inner nerd. All of their cocktails are named after various comic book, star wars, etc. They also have trivia on Wednesday night! If you check out their website you can find out what is going on that night.   The decor is so cool! They have an R2D2, a tiny throne from Game of Thrones among other things. The owner is also super nice and friendly.   I had a great time. I recommend the Bb8 drink :)   I highly recommend visiting this bar when you visit the downtown area.

Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: My favorite bar EVER !!! I first heard about this place on Buzzfeed.  One of the 21 most unique bars in the world that one was visit and visit it you MUST.   A nerd bar like no other that caters to all types of Geekdom.  From Star Wars to Dragonball Z you will find something that appeals to you.  The decor is the coolest thing that is a mix of Goth, Alice In Wonderland and the Cantina from Star Wars. The drinks are just as inventive.  I had to get a BB-8 and needless to say it was out of this world.  The staff was the BEST !!!  They made me feel like a local introducing me to everyone and making feel like Harry Potter at a local pub drinking butter beer.  It was the best.  The bartenders were the prettiest this side of Princess Leia and the owner Alex was nothing but nice and the French accent made me feel like I was in a Bond movie.  I can go on and on about this bar (and I have...sorry) but you have to go visit it when ever you are in Vegas. Awesome this bar is!!!
